Description: Body fragment of large North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery bowl; glaze fired red-brown; interior glazed with two bands of added red lined in white, and part of a third; exterior buff slip, decoration in three friezes of grazing wild goats (to left top and bottom, to right in middle); added red patches on shoulders and haunches; filling ornaments: roundels and dotted rosettes; bands with added red bands framed in white between the friezes. Drill hole in broken edge from sampling for clay analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Possibly by the same hand as G119.26.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.110)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.6; p.663, pl.8.13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
